items.content_html:
Description

Adding hasOwn() example to the section for accessing element properties.

Motivation

An issue was opened to request this addition because current documentation could expose web apps to property pollution. This change will inform readers that there are two ways to access dataset properties and one will mitigate against property pollution.

Additional details

  • Discussion in the issue thread suggested this document addition to supplement current docs.
  • Note: Only my second PR, so apologies in advance if there are any inadvertent errors. Happy to address them, of course.

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #28693
items.title: Updated docs for HTMLElement.dataset property checks

items.content_html:
Description

  • I changed the framing to talk about the structure rather than say "validation" to avoid conflating this header with the concept of a Validation Request/Response. Yes, any given implementation of a client, server, or proxy is likely to include have validation logic for HTTP headers, but I don't think we should imply that there is validation specified as part of the protocol itself with regard to this header.
  • I added an example for multiple directives
  • I expanded the explanation of arguments for directives, including an example and further clarification of syntax.

Motivation

Clarity and precision in our explanation of the protocol

Additional details
items.title: Cache-control: Adjusted description of cache directive structure

items.title: Change code block language from pug to js

items.content_html:
Description

The initial value of offset-position property is now normal. It was earlier auto.

Change in the default value of offset-position can be tracked here:

  • Spec: https://drafts.fxtf.org/motion/#offset-position-property
  • Spec update: w3c/fxtf-drafts@fc81ee1
  • Change implemented in Firefox:
    - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1835434
    - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1559232

Motivation

The examples and text on offset-position and ray() pages need to be adjusted for the default value of offset-position as normal.

Current ray() example After fixes in this PR (Fx122)

Additional details

  • Examples tested in Firefox 122 beta (releasing on Jan 23) and Chrome 120
  • Codepen: https://codepen.io/dipikabh/pen/ZEPKVGZ?editors=1100

Related issues and pull requests

PR to update the "Initial value" of offset-position: mdn/data#709
items.title: fix(css) Update `ray()` and `offset-position` text and examples for default `offset-position: normal`

items.title: Add clonable option and attribute

items.content_html:
Description

This PR updates some of the cookie information found on MDN, according to the cookie docs proposal that was made available a while ago.

While this PR doesn't make all of the changes listed in the proposal doc, it does the following:

  • Update the HTTP cookies guide to clean up the structure a bit, modernize the information, and move some of the information to other places.
  • Add a new Third-party cookies article to provide a single detailed definition of 3PC, the issues associated with them, and how to handle those issues.
  • [TODO] Clean up the Privacy landing page to remove some of the browser-specific information, move some of the content to more appropriate places, and generally clean up/improve.
  • [TODO] Update all the pages that provide their own definition of third party cookies/tracking and link them to the one single definition on the new 3PC article instead.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update cookie docs

items.content_html:
Following on from #31453 and #31497, this PR should finish updating legacy rgba and hsla syntax, closing #30844

I have left all Firefox releases as they were. I have also left https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/user_interface/Browser_styles#firefox_panel_components_legacy as it was.

In _redirects lines 804 and 11674 redirect to en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#rgb()_and_rgba(), however this heading doesn't exist in color_value. I thought maybe they should have instead redirected to en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value/rgb, but I'm not entirely sure so I haven't changed yet. If not, the heading part should probably be removed instead.
items.title: Update remaining `rgba()`/`hsla()` occurences to use latest syntax

items.content_html:
Description

While we do not yet have support for Mermaid inline in markdown, I've converted a few .png diagrams to SVG using https://www.mermaidchart.com.

Motivation

Removing binaries from the repo, improving maintenance of diagrams, easing transition to mermaid syntax in future.

Additional details

  • Discussion: https://github.com/orgs/mdn/discussions/631
Mermaid syntax 
%%{init: { "sequence": { "wrap": true, "width":250, "noteAlign": "center", "messageAlign": "center" }} }%%


sequenceDiagram
    participant Client
    participant Server

    Note left of Client: Request resource
    Client->>Server: GET /doc HTTP/1.1
    Note right of Server: Resource moved<br>Respond with new location
    Server-->>Client: HTTP/1.1 301 Moved Permanently<br/>Location: /doc_new

    Note left of Client: Request resource at new location
    Client->>Server: GET /doc_new HTTP/1.1
    Note right of Server: Return resource
    Server-->>Client: HTTP/1.1 200 OK

%%{init: { "sequence": { "wrap": true, "width":380, "noteAlign": "center", "messageAlign": "left" }} }%%

sequenceDiagram
    participant Client
    participant Server

    Note over Client: The client signifies its ability to understand two compression algorithms.
    Client->>Server: GET /doc HTTP/1.1<br/>Accept-Encoding: br, gzip
    Note over Server: The resource is sent compressed. The Vary header indicates that content negotiation has been used to select the algorithm.
    Server->>Client: HTTP/1.1 200 OK<br/>Content-Encoding: br<br/>Vary: Accept-Encoding

%%{init: { "sequence": { "wrap": true, "width": 175, "noteAlign": "center", "messageAlign": "left" }} }%%

sequenceDiagram
    participant Client
    participant Proxy1 as Proxy
    participant Proxy2 as Proxy
    participant Server

    Note over Client: Resource requested.
    Client->>Server: 
    Note over Server: Resource is compressed and returned.
    Server->>Client: 
    Note over Proxy1,Proxy2: Intermediate nodes do not uncompress the body.
    Note over Client: Client decompresses the body.

%%{init: { "sequence": { "wrap": true, "width": 130, "noteAlign": "center", "messageAlign": "left" }} }%%

sequenceDiagram
    participant Client
    participant N1 as Node
    participant N2 as Node
    participant N3 as Node
    participant Server

    Client-->>N1: Uncompressed
    Note left of Client: Client sends an uncompressed body.
    Note over N1,N3: Intermediate nodes send the body with or without compression on a hop-by-hop basis.
    N1-->>N2: Uncompressed
    N2->>N3: Compressed
    N3-->>Server: Uncompressed
    Note right of Server: The server receives an uncompressed body.


%%{init: { "sequence": { "wrap": true, "width": 175, "noteAlign": "center" }} }%%

sequenceDiagram
    participant Client
    participant Node1 as Node
    participant Node2 as Node
    participant Server

    Note over Client: Request message
    Client->>Node1: GET /doc HTTP/1.1

    Note over Node1: Shows support for compression while forwarding message.
    Node1->>Node2: GET /doc HTTP/1.1<br/>TE: gzip, br

    Note over Node2: Forwards message
    Node2->>Server: GET /doc HTTP/1.1

    Note over Server: Returns resource in an uncompressed body.
    Server->>Node2: HTTP/1.1 200 OK


    Note over Node2: Compresses body and forwards message.
    Node2->>Node1: HTTP/1.1 200 OK<br/>Transfer-Encoding: br

    Note over Node1: Uncompresses resource and returns message to Client.
    Node1->>Client: HTTP/1.1 200 OK

Related issues and pull requests

  • #30820
items.title: feat: Add SVG diagrams for HTTP sequences

items.content_html:
Description

HTMLVideoElement.requestVideoFrameCallback() and HTMLVideoElement.cancelVideoFrameCallback() have been supported in Chrome since version 83, and Safari since 15.4, but we haven't yet published docs for them.

This PR fixes that.

See https://web.dev/articles/requestvideoframecallback-rvfc for a useful test demo.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: feat: Add docs for *VideoFrameCallback() methods
